name: lastlarf
text: A comment left by lastlarf was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by littlecat, robobogle, tttt2)

name: honesttom
text: I now often use the phrase "enough _____ to wipe God's ass and the Devil too".

name: dont_think
text: You know this only works with paper, right?

name: atmus
text:
AND pinecones. Unfortunately, no one ever has enough pinecones to satisfy the requirements needed to use this phrase about them.


No, wait. That isn't unfortunate at all.

name: senseihollywood
text: I've got some paperwork for you to fill out and get back to me...

name: boredom_man
text: There's a bar on the Juarez tourist strip called The Cavern (to be distinguished from the strip club called The Cave). It is decorated with plaster-constructed stalagmites and stalactites, and is indeed one story underground. I have been to a poetry read there. I very nearly score 100%, but alas, I am nowhere near as cool as a cool Jackson.

name: tonyhighwind
text: You just need to keep using it, daddy-o, 'till them squares start knowing shit from Shinola, dig?

name: methadone
text: you rairly hear people expound on the amout of rolling papers they have

name: songbirdspectre
text: you, my good man, have never met me after a run to the smoke shop.

name: tim_simmons
text: he has three whole lids too. man he is awesome. he is the hippest cat.

name: idsyen
text: Roast Beef is shaking with excitement at how hip this cat is.

name: deimosrising
text:
Mingus's best record is The Black Saint and the Sinner Lady

If you disagree I encourage you to go to hell

name: remotevinyl
text: I used to think "Ah Um" was the best, but soon realized "The Black Saint and the Sinner Lady" was the superior album.

name: ttagxamm
text: While I dasn't disagree, don't sleep on the Changes One & Two, a smoking pair of late records.  "Orange Was the Color of Her Dress, Then Silk Blue,"Devil Blues," "Duke Ellington's Sound of Love." Shit is tight, and the band rolls deep: Jack Walrath, George Adams, Don Pullen, Dannie Richmond.

name: ferdinand
text: "black saint and the sinner lady" is perhaps the only album in the history of jazz to have liner notes written by the artist's psychiatrist.

name: honesttom
text: Haa, the cat with the beard said "ass".

name: mattylite
text: Mingus Mingus Mingus Mingus Mingus

name: tekende
text: Oh geez, I'm sorry, I shouldn't have lamed you. I thought you were saying Mingus over and over and then I realized you were claiming it as your favorite album.

name: mattylite
text: Mingus Moves. Oh Yeah, Mingus Plays the Piano. Let My Children Hear Music, tekende, The Clown Changes One.

name: pwb
text:
I agree, but Tonight at Noon is pretty good too

great strip

name: unclemikey
text: While I go to hell I'm going to hear Pithecanthropus Erectus in my head

name: catachresis
text: 5/5 for the damn concept alone. There was a cat who lived with Charles Mingus, and his name was Nightlife.

name: noah
text: Dude: it's true.  Mingus had a cat named Nightlife, and he taught that cat how to use the toilet.  This is a real thing.

name: appers
text: The best part is that Charles Mingus died 30 years ago, which makes Nightlife at least 140 in cat years .

name: ssddr
text: The link in the alt-text is bad, you can read Mingus'es pamphlet on this topic here though.

name: chaesar
text: Mingus' autobiography, "Beneath the Underdog" is amazing. Anyone who gives two shits about Charles Mingus, real jazz music or just enjoys a good story should look into it. He had this crazy libido and claims to have had sex with dozens of prostitutes in one night, down in Tijuana, lit up on grass and tequila.

name: cdl146
text: The album he wrote while down there, New Tijuana Moods, is fantastic.

name: joeynarcotic
text: Unfortunately the writing he did on music was censored, though they left the sex alone.

name: andrew_
text: I'm not one to assign particular roles in Achewood to particular people, but I imagined Snoop Dogg saying this the first time I read it.

name: andrew_
text: Nightlife, that is.

name: dovey
text: I always imagined more of a slow, deep, smooth voice. More an Isaac Hayes voice.

name: rowboat
text: Or , maybe a voice like Charles Mingus. Perhaps.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: no, 'cos that would just make too much sense.

name: closefriend
text: Nightlife always walks in from just off-panel without any introduction. He sits and eavesdrops and waits for just the right time to make his entrance.

name: professorhazard
text: He's the Chuck Mangione of the Achewood universe.

name: acefalco
text: I apologize, but saying positive things about Chuck Mangione gets you a lame.

name: aperson
text: I tried saying the Magic Words " All cats know how to use the damn toilet ", but no Nightlife did manifest.

name: stuart
text: Nightlife is extremely laid back about breaking and entering

name: cpnglxynchos
text: so are Ray and Beef, apparently.

name: c_dizzle
text: You know... I always DID refer to Migus as a 'cat.' CLEVER play on words, Onstad...clever.

name: c_dizzle
text: And I totally misread. Damnit.

name: blarghamagarky
text: 'scuse me Nightlife, I'm happy to see you 'an all, but how did you get into my house?

name: mindbnder
text: I did not get this strip when i ran through the archive the first time. This time I read the comments, followed the links, and discovered that it is brilliant .

name: drskradley
text:
"Ain't no thing...

"...but a chicken's wing."

...is a phrase that keeps coming to me at inappropriate times. People look at me funny, it's quite awful.

name: usversusthem
text: At least you don't mentally have "Ain't no thang but a chicken's wang" stuck in your head.

name: mattylite
text: At least you don't..have..a chicken's wang stuck in your head.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: repeatedly

name: fineoakstructure
text: It's odd; this is probably the Achewood phrase I use the most in general conversation, which is kind of disappointing, considering it's really none-too-special in the veritable encyclopedia of golden Achewood quotables.

name: theguitarhero
text: It's not even necessarily an Achewood saying, it's been around for a lot longer.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Yeah, I should've said "the line from Achewood I use the most."

You tyrant.

name: swatson
text:
I enjoy the 2nd to last pannel where Beef puts his paws on the back of the couch expectantly.

This is the part I enjoy.

name: crankheart
text: i haven't heard 'lid' since cheech and chong. it's been made umpteen-times cooler by nightlife though.

name: gunsofray
text: the fifth panel makes it for me because i always thought Ray got scared and was hiding behind Beef who was puffing his chest out

name: brokeaccount
text: Who the fuck drinks Tuaca anyway.

text:

name: cpnglxynchos
text: SHUT UP

name: vulpes-aurum
text: PORK-PIE HAT.
